<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized
	gains (losses) and investment income earned on investments available for sale were $(390,000), $(414,000), and $0, respectively, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	2013, and 2012, and have been included as a component of "Other income, net" in the accompanying financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Related Party Transactions and Warrant
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Peter Friedli.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Peter Friedli, the Chairman of our Board of Directors, or entities with which he is affiliated, have been
	responsible for procuring
	since 1993, an aggregate of approximately $270&nbsp;million in debt and equity financing for us and our predecessor company. Mr.&nbsp;Friedli is the beneficial owner of approximately 43% of our
	common stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2014. Of the shares beneficially owned by Mr.&nbsp;Friedli at December&nbsp;31, 2014, 85,000 shares were received by him as Board compensation since 1996,
	12,500 shares were granted in recognition of his fundraising efforts, as discussed below, 567,610 shares were received by him upon his net exercise of a warrant to purchase 1,000,000 shares of our
	common stock at $11.00 per share, as described below, and the remaining shares were acquired through investment or through purchase from third parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Of
	the 85,000 shares received by Mr.&nbsp;Friedli as board compensation since 1996, 10,000 shares, then valued at approximately $149,300, were issued to Mr.&nbsp;Friedli in 2014,
	10,000 shares, then valued at approximately $77,000, were issued to Mr.&nbsp;Friedli in 2013, and 10,000 shares, then valued at approximately $51,000, were issued to Mr.&nbsp;Friedli in 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	86
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=86,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=554242,FOLIO='86',FILE='DISK130:[14ZDG1.14ZDG13301]FS13301A.;19',USER='CHE108069',CD='20-MAR-2015;01:59' -->
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS13301_1_87">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223659Z10-K_HTM_BG13301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Related Party Transactions and Warrant (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	response to Mr.&nbsp;Friedli's successful efforts in procuring for us accommodations relative to financing transactions that had occurred prior to our initial public offering, we
	issued to Mr.&nbsp;Friedli in 2006, in connection with and just prior to our initial public offering, a warrant exercisable for up to 1,000,000 shares of our common stock at $11.00 per share, the
	price for which shares were sold in the initial
	public offering. This warrant was originally scheduled to expire in May 2011and was extended to expire in fiscal 2015 by a vote of our stockholders at the 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Friedli
	exercised this warrant on August&nbsp;14, 2013 using the Net Exercise Method, resulting in the net issuance of 567,610 shares of our common stock. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, we no longer have any outstanding warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prolexys Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the third quarter of fiscal 2011 we entered into a contract research agreement with
	Prolexys
	Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc. under which we are conducting for Prolexys an early stage clinical trial investigating a novel compound as a product candidate for cancer therapeutics. This contract was
	filed as an exhibit to and discussed in a Current Report on Form&nbsp;8-K filed by us with the SEC primarily because of the related nature of the management and ownership of Prolexys with us and our
	management and with certain of our significant stockholders, and not because our rights or obligations under the contract research agreement with Prolexys are otherwise material to us. We are not
	incurring any third party costs related to our work with Prolexys and are primarily contributing only the efforts of employees. All third party costs associated with the Prolexys study are paid
	directly by Prolexys. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the amount of internal resources we have devoted to Prolexys is not material to our operations as a whole.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prolexys
	is 35.7% owned by BIH&nbsp;SA, which owns 7.8% of our outstanding common stock; 24.3% owned by Peter Friedli who is the Chairman of our Board of Directors and direct owner of
	29.3% of our common stock; and 13.8% owned by Venturetec,&nbsp;Inc., which holds 12.5% of our common stock. Peter Friedli is the President and an approximately 2% owner of Venturetec,&nbsp;Inc.
	Mr.&nbsp;Friedli has also recently reported the acquisition of a convertible bond that would entitle him, upon conversion, to acquire an additional approximately 19% interest in
	Venturetec,&nbsp;Inc. Lode Debrabandere, our Chief Executive Officer, serves on the Board of Directors of Prolexys, but has no other interest therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	arrangement is part of our ongoing efforts to expand our portfolio of product candidates, but we do not consider this arrangement to be material to us at this time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Board of Directors and Audit Committee, including all of our independent directors, but with Mr.&nbsp;Friedli abstaining, unanimously approved this transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. Income Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For income tax reporting purposes, we reported taxable income in fiscal 2014 and 2013, compared to a loss in fiscal 2012. The income in 2014 and 2013 was primarily attributable to the
	gain from sale of discontinued operations which are reflected in the statements of comprehensive (loss) income, net of income taxes. Continuing operations below reflect a tax expense in the amount of
	$193,000 and a benefit in the amount of $1.3&nbsp;million generated during fiscal 2014 and 2013, respectively. Included in the 2013 amount is $79,000 of taxes recoverable from a prior period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	87
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. Income Taxes (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Included
	as a component of discontinued operations was a tax expense of $0.9&nbsp;million and $1.7&nbsp;million for 2014 and 2013, respectively. The gain from sale of discontinued
	operations in 2013 included interest to be accrued in the amount of $70,000 which increased income taxes payable. In the future, the utilization of our tax attributes will be limited to the federal
	alternative minimum tax threshold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	effective tax rate benefit (expense) varies from the U.S. Federal Statutory tax rate principally due to the following:
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	presently have available for federal income tax purposes, approximately $70.5&nbsp;million of general business credit carry-forwards, which expire beginning in 2025 through 2032. In
	addition, we
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	88
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=88,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=157105,FOLIO='88',FILE='DISK130:[14ZDG1.14ZDG13301]FS13301A.;19',USER='CHE108069',CD='20-MAR-2015;01:59' -->
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS13301_1_89">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223659Z10-K_HTM_BG13301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. Income Taxes (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	have
	approximately $1.67&nbsp;million alternative minimum tax credit carry- forwards as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, which do not expire. In addition, the windfall equity-based compensation
	deductions are tracked, but will not be recorded to the balance sheet until Management determines that such amounts will be utilized. During 2014, we had $5.4&nbsp;million, of windfall stock
	compensation deductions. When realized, the tax benefit associated with these deductions will be credited to additional paid-in capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	ability to realize its deferred tax assets depends primarily upon the generation of sufficient future taxable income to allow for the utilization of the Company's deductible
	temporary differences and upon tax planning strategies. Realization of net deferred tax assets is dependent on the Company's ability to generate future taxable income, which is uncertain. We have
	recorded a valuation allowance of $72.7&nbsp;million and $72.6&nbsp;million, against the Company's net deferred tax assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31 2013, respectively,
	as Management believes it is more likely than not that the assets will not be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Utilization
	of the credit carryforwards may be subject to an annual limitation due to the ownership change limitations provided by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and
	similar state provisions. The Company has not performed a detailed analysis to determine whether an ownership change under Section&nbsp;382 of the Internal Revenue Code occurred. The effect of an
	ownership change would be the imposition of an annual limitation on the use of credits attributable to periods before the change and could result in a reduction in the total credits available.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are subject to income taxes in the United States and several states. Tax regulations within each jurisdiction are subject to the interpretation of the related tax laws and regulations
	and require significant judgment to apply. The Company had tax net operating losses and credit carryforwards that are subject to examination for a number of years beyond the year in which they are
	generated for tax purposes. Since a portion of these carryforwards may be utilized in the future, many of these attribute carryforwards remain subject to examination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	policy is to recognize interest and penalties related to income tax matters in income tax expense. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2013, we had no accruals for
	interest or penalties related to income tax matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. Defined Contribution Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have a 401(k) plan that is available to all employees. Employee contributions are voluntary and are determined on an individual basis up to the amount allowable under federal
	regulations. Employer contributions to the plan are at the discretion of the Board of Directors and vest over a seven year period beginning after the third year of eligibility. No employer
	contributions have been made to date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	89
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=89,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=630037,FOLIO='89',FILE='DISK130:[14ZDG1.14ZDG13301]FS13301A.;19',USER='CHE108069',CD='20-MAR-2015;01:59' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU13301_1_90">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223659Z10-K_HTM_BG13301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contract Research Organizations.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We utilize independent contract research organizations ("CROs") to perform many of the tasks
	required under our
	clinical trials. We rely on CROs for their testing expertise and to ensure the objectivity of our clinical results. Under the terms of these agreements, we design the protocol regarding the testing to
	be performed, and the CRO assists in the enrollment of the patients and testing sites, administers the trial, performs statistical analysis of the results, and compiles the final report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	pay fees directly to the CROs for their professional services, which may be payable upon specified trial milestones or as they provide services, depending on the structure of the
	contract. We are also responsible for reimbursing the CROs for certain pass thru expenses they incur in administering the trial. The timing of our payments to the CROs is dependent upon the progress
	of the various trials, which is highly variable dependent upon the speed with which the CROs are able to enroll patients and testing sites. As such, we are unable to specifically predict the timing of
	future payments to CROs. We may also utilize CROs for future clinical trials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	total cost of these future obligations is estimated to be approximately $10.7&nbsp;million which is expected to be paid through 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Leases.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2006, we entered into a sublease agreement for approximately 61,000 square feet of laboratory, production,
	warehouse, and office space
	in Columbia, Maryland. We have also entered into a direct lease with the owner of this facility that was effective as of June&nbsp;1, 2009 upon the expiration of the sublease and originally expired
	in July 2016. According to the terms of the lease agreement, we were required to provide a letter of credit which was fully collateralized by restricted cash and as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, the letter of credit of $243,000 remained outstanding. In September 2014, we entered into an amendment to the operating lease for our Columbia, Maryland facilities, extending
	the term of the lease through July 2023 and increasing the future minimum lease commitment by $9.0&nbsp;million. The lease amendment includes an allowance for tenant improvements of approximately
	$1.5&nbsp;million that we expect to utilize in 2015 to expand our manufacturing facilities and adjust our office space to accommodate our additional employees. Under the amended lease agreement, we
	also replaced the $243,000 letter of credit with a $95,000 cash deposit and eliminated all restricted cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	future minimum lease payments due under the operating lease for this facility are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU13301_1_91">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223659Z10-K_HTM_BG13301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	expenses under this lease were $1.3&nbsp;million, $1.3&nbsp;million, and $1.3&nbsp;million, during 2014, 2013, and 2012, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically,
	we also have entered into various financing arrangements to lease laboratory and other equipment. The terms of these facilities and equipment leases are considered
	capitalized leases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	discussed in Note&nbsp;6
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Capital Lease
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, in July 2012, we leased an additional $228,000 of equipment under a capital lease, which was
	included in our balance sheets at December&nbsp;31, 2014 along with $114,100 of accumulated depreciation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are subject to certain litigation, claims and assessments which occur in the normal course of business. Based on
	consultation with our
	legal counsel, management is of the opinion that there are no matters that are probable or reasonably possible that require accrual or disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. Derivative and Securities Received in Business Disposition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The only derivative instrument to which the company was a party was the price protection related to the shares received from Mesoblast as part of the disposition of our Therapeutics
	business. As discussed in Note&nbsp;2&#151;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Discontinued Operations,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the $15&nbsp;million milestone for completed delivery of the ceMSC assets
	was payable in either cash or stock, at Mesoblast's election. Because Mesoblast made that payment in stock, the Purchase Agreement provided that these shares were subject to a one year holding period,
	during which time we were afforded limited protection for any drop in the Mesoblast share price. In the event that the shares decreased in value during the holding period, we would be compensated for
	100% of the decrease in value, with 50% of the decrease payable to us in cash, and the remaining 50% again payable in either cash or ordinary shares, at Mesoblast's election. Any additional shares
	issued would have been subject to an additional one year holding period, but would not be afforded price protection.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	price protection was recorded as a part of the initial consideration received under the Purchase Agreement at its fair value as of that date of $1.7&nbsp;million. We evaluated this
	downside protection, and determined that it met the criteria of a derivative instrument under ASC 815. As such, the price protection derivative was re-measured at its fair value with change in fair
	value recorded in net income as a component of "Other income".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	December, the price protection for the Mesoblast ordinary shares expired, but Mesoblast agreed to pay us no less than $15&nbsp;million in cash for the stock prior to the end of the
	first half of fiscal 2015. Accordingly, we no longer have a derivative instrument as of December&nbsp;31, 2014. The fair value of the price protection derivative was $1.7&nbsp;million as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, which was included as a component of "Trading Securities." From the closing of the sale of the Therapeutics business through December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively,
	we recorded a loss of $1.7&nbsp;million and $52,000 on the price protection, which was included as a component of "Other income."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	shares of Mesoblast to which the price protection relates were received by the Company on December&nbsp;18, 2013 and were required to be held for one year from the date of receipt.
	The fair value of the shares when they were received was $15&nbsp;million. The Company elected to remeasure the
	Mesoblast shares at fair value, with changes in fair value being recorded as a component of "Other income". As such, the statement of comprehensive (loss) income impact of changes in the fair value of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	91
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</P>

	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. Derivative and Securities Received in Business Disposition (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the
	Mesoblast shares and the statement of comprehensive (loss) income impact of changes in the fair value of the price protection derivative largely offset each other during the mandatory holding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of the Mesoblast shares as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, determined by reference to the trading price of identical Mesoblast ordinary shares on the Australian
	Securities Exchange, was $10.6&nbsp;million and $15.4&nbsp;million, respectively. The gain during the period from December&nbsp;18, 2013 through December&nbsp;31, 2013 was $401,000. The loss
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $401,000. The difference of $4.4&nbsp;million between the fair value of the Mesoblast shares, and the guaranteed payment of $15&nbsp;million is
	included in "Other Receivables" on our Balance Sheets as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Fair Value
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair value is defined as the price at which an asset could be exchanged or a liability transferred (an exit price) in an orderly transaction between knowledgeable, willing parties in the
	principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability. Where available, fair value is based on observable market prices or parameters or derived from such prices or parameters. Where
	observable prices or inputs are not available, valuation models are applied.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial
	assets recorded at fair value in the accompanying financial statements are categorized based upon the level of judgment associated with the inputs used to measure their fair
	value. The levels are
	directly related to the amount of subjectivity associated with the inputs to fair valuation of these assets and liabilities, and are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_26"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:100%;MARGIN-LEFT:0%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="45PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END -->
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Level&nbsp;1
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Inputs are unadjusted, quoted prices in active markets for identical assets at the reporting date. Active markets are those in which transactions for the asset or liability occur in sufficient frequency and volume to
	provide pricing information on an ongoing basis.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The fair valued assets we hold that are generally included in this category are money market securities and the Mesoblast shares received in the disposition of the Therapeutics business, where fair value is based on
	publicly quoted prices.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Level&nbsp;2
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Inputs are other than quoted prices included in Level&nbsp;1, which are either directly or indirectly observable for the asset or liability through correlation with market data at the reporting date and for the
	duration of the instrument's anticipated life.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The fair valued assets we hold that are generally included in this category are investment grade short-term securities and our derivative instrument.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Level&nbsp;3
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities and which reflect management's best estimate of what market participants
	would use in pricing the asset or liability at the reporting date. Consideration is given to the risk inherent in the valuation technique and the risk inherent in the inputs to the model.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The only asset we hold that is included in this category is the price protection derivative related to the Mesoblast shares received in the disposition of our Therapeutics business.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223659Z10-K_HTM_BG13301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Fair Value (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When
	quoted prices in active markets for identical assets are available, we use these quoted market prices to determine the fair value of financial assets and classify these assets as
	Level&nbsp;1. In other cases where a quoted market price for identical assets in an active market is either not available or not observable, we obtain the fair value from a third party vendor that
	uses pricing models, such as matrix pricing, to determine fair value. These financial assets would then be classified as Level&nbsp;2. In the event quoted market prices were not available, we would
	determine fair value using broker quotes or an internal analysis of each investment's financial statements and cash flow projections. In these instances, financial assets would be classified based
	upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the valuation. Thus, financial assets might be classified in Level&nbsp;3 even though there could be some significant inputs that may be readily
	available. There have been no transfers between level&nbsp;1 and 2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	price protection derivative related to the Mesoblast shares was classified in Level&nbsp;3. Its fair value was determined through use of the Black-Scholes valuation method, a
	standard industry methodology for valuing equity options, because the price protection is economically equivalent to a put option on the Mesoblast shares at a price of $15&nbsp;million. Significant
	inputs to the model include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fair
	value of underlying Mesoblast stock: $15,000,000
<BR>
	Contractual life: 1.0&nbsp;year
<BR>
	Volatility: 40%
<BR>
	Risk-free interest rate: 0.13%
<BR>
	Expected dividends: $0
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	price protection related to Mesoblast shares ended in December 2014. There were no other transfers in and out of Level&nbsp;3. The following table represents a rollforward of the
	fair value of Level&nbsp;3 instruments, comprised solely of the limited price protection derivative related to the Mesoblast stock issued to us in connection with the sale of our former Therapeutics
	business:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_27"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">

</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_31"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014, 2013 AND 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. Quarterly Financial Data (Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following is a summary of our unaudited quarterly results for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:73%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"110%" -->

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. Subsequent Events
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We evaluated our December&nbsp;31, 2014 financial statements for subsequent events through the date the financial statements were issued. Pursuant to the exclusive distribution
	agreement we entered into with a subsidiary of Stryker Corporation in December 2014, we received the initial exclusivity fee of $5&nbsp;million from Stryker in February 2015. This fee was required
	to be paid by Stryker within five business days of receipt of documents outlined in the December&nbsp;2014 agreement. We are not aware of any other subsequent events which would require recognition
	or disclosure in the financial statements.
</FONT>

<EFX_PART_II>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_II_2"></A>
<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_GC13301_ITEM_9__CHANGES_IN_AND_DISAGRE__ITE03557">
</A>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_TOC_GC13301_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;None.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_GC13301_ITEM_9A__CONTROLS_AND_PROCEDURES_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_TOC_GC13301_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our
	"disclosure controls and
	procedures" (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended), as of the end of the period covered by this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K was made under
	the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer. Based upon this evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
	Financial Officer have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures (a)&nbsp;are effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in reports filed or submitted under the
	Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is timely recorded, processed, summarized and reported and (b)&nbsp;include, without limitation, controls and procedures designed to ensure that information required
	to be disclosed by us in reports filed or submitted under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
	Financial Officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Previously Reported Material Weakness.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we developed and implemented new control
	procedures to address
	a previously identified material weakness in our internal control over financial reporting. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, our management determined that our processes, procedures and controls
	related to financial reporting were not effective to ensure effective oversight of the work performed by, and the accuracy of financial information or professional conclusions provided by, third-party
	tax advisors, regarding components of the income tax provision calculation (specifically the allocation between continuing and discontinuing operations), given a one-time significant transaction of
	disposing of a business segment. We have taken steps to remediate the material weakness, including adherence to existing control procedures and implementation of enhanced controls related to review
	and oversight of complex transactions and infrequent events. Additionally, we engaged a new third party tax advisor to oversee and prepare the Company's tax provision and other related documents. We
	believe that these remediation efforts have improved our internal control over tax accounting, as well as our disclosure controls and procedures, and that the material weakness has been remediated at
	December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's report on internal control over financial
	reporting is included in
	"Item&nbsp;8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Attestation Report of Registered Public Accounting Firm.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BDO USA,&nbsp;LLP's attestation report on our internal control over
	financial reporting is
	included in "Item&nbsp;8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With the exception of the remediation efforts described above, there has
	been no change in our
	internal control over financial reporting that
	occurred in the annual period covered by this report that materially affect our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<EFX_PART_III>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_III"></A>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain information required in Part&nbsp;III is omitted from this report, but is incorporated by reference from our definitive proxy
	statement for the 2014 Annual Meeting of Stockholders anticipated to be filed within 120&nbsp;days after the end of our fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, pursuant to Regulation&nbsp;14A
	with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_GC13301_ITEM_10__DIRECTORS,_EXECUTIVE___ITE02317">
</A>
<A NAME="A2223659Z10-K_HTM_TOC_GC13301_5">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information required by this item and not set forth below is incorporated herein by reference to the information contained in the
	Proxy Statement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have adopted the Osiris Therapeutics,&nbsp;Inc. Code of Business Conduct&nbsp;&amp; Ethics for Members of the Board of Directors and Executive Officers and the Osiris
	Therapeutics,&nbsp;Inc. Code of Conduct which applies to all our employees and members of the Board of Directors. These policies are publicly available on our website at
	http://www//investor.osiris.com/documents.cfm.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit&nbsp;10.7
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THIRD AMENDMENT TO AGREEMENT OF LEASE
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	THIS THIRD AMENDMENT TO AGREEMENT OF LEASE
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(this &#147;Amendment&#148;) is made this 25th day of September&nbsp;2014, by
<B>
	COLUMBIA GATEWAY S-28, L.L.C.,
</B>
	a Maryland limited liability company (&#147;Landlord&#148;) and
<B>
	OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS,&nbsp;INC.,
</B>
	a Maryland corporation (&#147;Tenant&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	W I T N E S S E T H:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	WHEREAS, Landlord and Tenant entered into that Agreement of Lease dated June&nbsp;6, 2006, as amended by that certain Letter Agreement dated June&nbsp;14, 2006, that certain First Amendment to Agreement of Lease dated June&nbsp;19, 2010, and that certain Second Amendment to Agreement of Lease dated July&nbsp;9, 2010 (collectively, the &#147;Lease&#148;), by the terms of which Tenant leases from Landlord and Landlord leases to Tenant that certain premises containing an agreed upon equivalent of 61,203 square feet of rentable area (the &#147;Premises&#148;), comprised of the entire office building located at 7015 Albert Einstein Drive, Columbia, Maryland 21044 (the &#147;Building&#148;), all as more particularly described in the Lease for a term which expires on July&nbsp;31, 2016;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	WHEREAS, Landlord and Tenant mutually desire to extend the term of the Lease and to amend the same with respect to the Base Rent and certain other matters of the Lease, all as more particularly set forth below; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	WHEREAS, all capitalized terms used in this Amendment which are not defined herein shall have the meanings given to them in the Lease, unless the context otherwise requires.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the above Recitals and the mutual covenants and conditions contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Landlord and Tenant agree as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Extension of Term
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.&#160; Landlord and Tenant agree that the Term of the Lease shall be extended for one (1)&nbsp;additional period of seven (7)&nbsp;years and three (3)&nbsp;months, commencing on August&nbsp;1, 2016, and expiring October&nbsp;31, 2023 (the &#147;First Renewal Term&#148;).&#160; Tenant&#146;s rental of the Premises during the First Renewal Term shall be on the same terms, covenants and conditions set forth in the Lease, provided, however, that Tenant shall pay as Base Rent during the First Renewal Term the amounts set forth below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=756534,FOLIO='',FILE="DISK131:[14ZDG2.14ZDG13302]26233-2-KS-01_ZDG13302.CHC",USER="BGARDNE",CD='MAR 13 05:04 2015' -->
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	**Annualized based on a full year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Tenant Improvement Allowance
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.&nbsp; Tenant acknowledges that except as otherwise described herein, the Premises are leased to Tenant for the First Renewal Term in its &#147;as-is&#148; condition as of the date of this Amendment and that Landlord is not obligated to make any improvements to the Premises.&#160; At anytime during the period of January&nbsp;1, 2015 &#151; December&nbsp;31, 2016, Tenant, at Tenant&#146;s request, shall have the right to make such improvements to the Premises as are approved by Landlord, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Landlord hereby grants Tenant an allowance not to exceed One Million Five Hundred Thirty Thousand Seventy Five and 00/100 Dollars ($1,530,075.00) (the &#147;Allowance&#148;) towards the costs of such improvements.&#160; Such improvements shall be subject to the provisions of
<U>
	Section&nbsp;10
</U>
	of the Lease. Tenant shall be responsible for preparing all construction documents (&#147;Tenant&#146;s Construction Documents&#148;), subject to Landlord&#146;s prior consent, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.&#160; Tenant shall submit to Landlord completed construction documents for Landlord&#146;s review and approval.&#160; Within ten (10)&nbsp;business days following Landlord&#146;s receipt of the Tenant Construction Documents, Landlord shall review, and in Landlord&#146;s reasonable discretion, either approve the same or notify Tenant of Landlord&#146;s objections thereto and, if applicable, Landlord&#146;s proposed modifications. If Landlord has any objections to the Tenant Construction Documents, Landlord shall identify such objections in a written notice to Tenant.&#160; Within five (5)&nbsp;business days of receiving Landlord&#146;s objections, Tenant shall address the objections and deliver revised Tenant Construction Documents to Landlord for approval in the same manner.&#160; The Tenant Construction Documents shall conform to all Legal Requirements applicable to the Tenant Work, and to Landlord&#146;s rules&nbsp;and regulations concerning Building safety, fire and protection of persons from injury.&#160; Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord&#146;s approval of the Tenant Construction Documents shall not constitute a representation or warranty by Landlord that the Tenant Construction Documents are in compliance with building codes or other applicable laws. Tenant&#146;s improvements shall be referred to as the &#147;Tenant&#146;s Work.&#148; Tenant shall apply for and obtain all required permits and deliver copies thereof to Landlord prior to commencing Tenant&#146;s Work.&#160; In such event, Landlord shall disburse the Allowance in accordance with the following provisions:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Allowance shall be disbursed to Tenant on a progress payment basis.&#160; Proper draw requests submitted by the 20th day of any calendar month shall be paid by the 15th day of the following calendar month.&#160; Each of Landlord&#146;s progress payments shall be limited to an amount equal to the aggregate amounts theretofore paid by Tenant (as certified by Tenant&#146;s architect) to Tenant&#146;s contractors, subcontractors, material suppliers, and vendors, and which have not been subject to previous disbursements from the Allowance.&#160; Tenant shall withhold from its general contractor, and shall require its general contractor to withhold from each subcontractor, a retainage equal to ten percent (10%) of each progress payment made until the Tenant&#146;s Work is fifty percent (50%) complete, and thereafter no further incremental retainage shall be required if the work is being satisfactorily prosecuted.&#160; Tenant shall, upon Landlord&#146;s request, provide adequate evidence of such retainage, and in the event that Tenant fails to provide such evidence, then Landlord may withhold an amount equal to the retainage described above.&#160; All requests for disbursement of the Allowance, if any, shall be accompanied by certificate signed by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s architect (a)&nbsp;that the sum then requested was paid by Tenant to contractors, subcontractors, materialmen, engineers and other persons who have rendered services or furnished materials in connection with work on the Tenant Work, (b)&nbsp;a complete description of such services and materials and the amounts paid or to be paid to each of such persons in respect thereof, and (c)&nbsp;that the work described in the certificate has been completed substantially in accordance with the approved plans and specifications and (ii)&nbsp;paid receipts or such other proof of payment as Landlord shall reasonably require for all such work completed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	If any of the Allowance is not paid pursuant to subsection 2.1 above, it shall be paid by Landlord to Tenant upon completion of the Tenant&#146;s Work, to reimburse Tenant for amounts actually paid by Tenant in connection therewith to Tenant&#146;s vendors, suppliers or contractors, provided that Landlord shall have received (i)&nbsp;a certificate in accordance with the requirements of subsection 2.1 above, accompanied by lien waivers satisfactory to Landlord executed by any contractors or subcontractors for whose labor or material Tenant has previously been reimbursed pursuant to subsection 2.1 above, (ii)&nbsp;paid receipts or such other proof of payment as Landlord shall reasonably require evidencing that final payment has been made for all materials and labor furnished in connection with the Tenant Work, and (iii)&nbsp;a copy of a final unconditional certificate of occupancy evidencing that Tenant may commence occupancy of the Premises for all purposes set forth in the Lease if one is required for Tenant&#146;s occupancy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2.3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Tenant shall be permitted to apply the Allowance and Amortized Amount to costs associated with Tenant&#146;s Work, including without limitation, the Tenant&#146;s Work, space planning and design, mechanical, electrical
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=2,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=851415,FOLIO='',FILE="DISK131:[14ZDG2.14ZDG13302]26233-2-KS-01_ZDG13302.CHC",USER="BGARDNE",CD='MAR 13 05:04 2015' -->
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	and plumbing engineering costs, construction fees, tenant improvement cabling, voice/data, phone data costs, built-in furniture and any professional or consulting fees specifically related to Tenant&#146;s Work. Any unused Allowing remaining as of January&nbsp;1, 2016 shall be deemed forfeited by Tenant and shall not be reserved for future improvements or credited to rent due under the Lease. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event Tenant is involved in litigation, arbitration or other similar claim dispute with a vendor, supplier or contractor that completed work as part of Tenant&#146;s Work and as the result of such dispute Tenant is unable to provide the necessary lien waiver documentation to Landlord as part of its request for final Allowance disbursement, upon receipt of written notice from Tenant, Landlord agrees to extend the deadline of January&nbsp;1, 2016 for an amount not to exceed ten percent&#160; (10%) of the Allowance, until July&nbsp;1, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. On or before March&nbsp;31, 2015, subject to reasonable delays caused by weather events, Landlord, at its sole cost and expense and not paid from the Allowance or included as a Building Expense, shall replace and resize all existing base Building HVAC units, including those which service the Premises, but excluding those specific units which have been previously installed by Tenant which are dedicated to Tenant&#146;s clean room (i.e, Units #10, 13, 17, 19, 24 and 27) (&#147;Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work&#148;). Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work shall be fully designed and engineered by a professional engineer registered in the state of Maryland, permitted and inspected by the authority having jurisdiction, and meet the performance criteria (i.e. thermal comfort, dehumidification, and energy consumption) for similar Class&nbsp;A flex buildings in Columbia, MD and ASHRAE and humidity standards for office use and upon completion of Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work, Landlord shall ensure the new units have been properly balanced by an NEBB Certified balancing contractor and all operation and controls fully tested and commissioned by the installation contractor, building controls vendor and HVAC equipment manufacturer, with such commissioning observed by Tenant or Tenant&#146;s representatives. Landlord and Tenant hereby agree to reasonably cooperate with each other during the completion of Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work in order to minimize any disruption to Tenant&#146;s business. Following the completion of Landlord&#146;s HVAC Work, Tenant shall be responsible for the repair and maintenance of the new HVAC units at its sole cost and expense in accordance with
<U>
	Section&nbsp;11
</U>
	of the Lease. Landlord shall purchase a one (1)&nbsp;year warranty from the installation contractor on all parts and labor and shall administer this warranty on behalf of Tenant during this one (1)&nbsp;year period.&#160; Landlord shall also reasonably assist Tenant in administering any manufacturer warranties on behalf of Tenant.&#160; Landlord and Landlord&#146;s installation contractor shall provide training on all new HVAC equipment and shall provide detailed O&amp;M manuals to Tenant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Landlord&#146;s Roof Work
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. On or before March&nbsp;31, 2015, subject to reasonable delays caused by weather events, Landlord, at its sole cost and expense and not paid from the Allowance or included as a Building Expense, shall replace the roof of the Building (&#147;Landlord&#146;s Roof Work&#148;). Landlord and Tenant hereby agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with each other during the completion of Landlord&#146;s Roof Work in order to minimize any disruption to Tenant&#146;s business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Laboratory Restoration
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. As part of Tenant&#146;s Work, Tenant hereby agrees to perform certain improvements to the laboratory portion of the Premises approved by Landlord, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Repairs and Maintenance
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. Effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2015,
<U>
	Sections 11.1 and 11.2
</U>
	of the Lease are hereby deleted in their entirety and the following is hereby inserted in lieu thereof:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Tenant&#146;s Care of the Premises and Building
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.&#160; During the Term Tenant shall:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	keep the Premises and the fixtures, appurtenances, improvements and equipment therein in good order and condition;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	make any and all repairs and replacements to the Premises required because of Tenant&#146;s misuse or primary negligence, except to the extent that the repairs or replacements are covered by Landlord&#146;s insurance as required hereunder;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	repair and replace special equipment or decorative treatments installed by or at Tenant&#146;s request and that serve the Premises only, except to the extent the repairs or replacements are needed because of Landlord&#146;s misuse or primary negligence, and are not covered by Tenant&#146;s insurance as required hereunder;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=3,EFW="2223659",CP="OSIRIS THERAPEUTICS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=549786,FOLIO='',FILE="DISK131:[14ZDG2.14ZDG13302]26233-2-KS-01_ZDG13302.CHC",USER="BGARDNE",CD='MAR 13 05:04 2015' -->
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	pay for all damage to the Building, its fixtures and appurtenances, as well as all damages sustained by Tenant or occupants of the Building due to any waste, misuse or neglect of the Premises, its fixtures and appurtenances by Tenant, except to the extent that the repair of such damage is covered by Landlord&#146;s insurance as required hereunder to the extent that Landlord actually receives proceeds there from;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	provide regular janitorial service to the Premises and remove all trash to receptacles designated by Landlord; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	not commit waste.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In addition Tenant shall not place a load upon any floor of the Premises exceeding the floor load per square foot area which such floor was designed to carry and which may be allowed under Applicable Laws.&#160; Landlord reserves the right to prescribe the weight and position of all heavy equipment brought onto the Premises and prescribe any reinforcing required under the circumstances, all such reinforcing to be at Tenant&#146;s expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11.2
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Landlord&#146;s Repairs
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.&#160; Except for the repairs and replacements that Tenant is required to make pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;11.1
</U>
	above, Landlord shall maintain, repair and replace, as necessary, the exterior Common Areas and Building (including Building fixtures and equipment) as shall be reasonably deemed necessary to maintain the Building in a condition comparable to other first class suburban office buildings in the Baltimore-Washington corridor area.&#160; This maintenance shall include the roof, designated parking areas, foundation, exterior walls, interior structural walls, all structural components, and all systems such as mechanical, electrical, HVAC, and plumbing.&#160; The costs associated with such repairs shall be deemed a part of Building Expenses; provided, however, that costs of all of such repairs which would be considered capital in nature under generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;) shall be included in Building Expenses, amortized in accordance with GAAP.&#160; There shall be no allowance to Tenant for a diminution of rental value, no abatement of rent, and no liability on the part of Landlord by reason of inconvenience, annoyance or injury to business arising from Landlord, Tenant or others making any repairs or performing maintenance as provided for herein. Notwithstanding, Landlord will use commercially reasonable efforts to not interfere with Tenant&#146;s business operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	7.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Building Expenses
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. Effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2015,
<U>
	Section&nbsp;6.2.2
</U>
	of the Lease is hereby deleted in its entirety and the following is hereby inserted in lieu thereof:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.2.2&#160; &#147;Building Expenses&#148; shall be all those expenses, charges and fees paid or incurred by Landlord in connection with the owning, maintaining, operating, servicing, insuring and repairing of the Property or any part thereof, in a manner deemed reasonable and appropriate by Landlord and shall include, without limitation, the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.2.2.1&nbsp; All costs and expenses of operating, repairing, lighting, cleaning, and insuring (including liability for personal injury, death and property damage and workers&#146; compensation insurance covering personnel) the Property or any part thereof, as well as all costs incurred in removing snow, ice and debris therefrom and of policing and regulating traffic with respect thereto, and depreciation of all machinery and equipment used therein or thereon, replacing or repairing of pavement, parking areas, curbs, walkways, drainage, lighting facilities, landscaping (including replanting and replacing flowers and other planting);
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.2.2.2 Except to the extent directly paid by Tenant pursuant to
<U>
	Section&nbsp;24
</U>
	of the Lease, electricity, steam and fuel used in lighting, heating, ventilating and air conditioning and all costs, charges, and expenses incurred by Landlord in connection with any change of any company providing electricity service, including, without limitation, maintenance, repair, installation and service costs associated therewith, as well as all expenses associated with the installation of any energy or cost savings devices;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>

	6.2.2.9&nbsp;Management fees equal to 3% of gross rental received by Landlord at the Property (allocated to their time spent working with respect to the Property) and the provision of amenities to all tenants in the Property (including Landlord&#146;s share of all payroll taxes and the cost of an on-site or near-site office and segregated storage area for Landlord&#146;s parts, tools and supplies);
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6.2.2.8&nbsp; Costs and expenses that may result from compliance with any governmental laws or regulations that were not applicable to the Property at the time same were originally constructed; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
